Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2009 05:52AM Nannieannie wrote: I had a double mastectomy April 27 and have been batteling the same problem. I was going back to the Dr every week for the first 2 months. Then after my first chemo my rigt side swelled up like a balloon. Thought I had an infection but I didn't. I am still swolen on the right side but I don't have the liquid rolling around like I did. It is hard around the incession but fluid on the rib cage. I have no signs of lymphodema.
Posts.Title: draining of seroma rkt rkt

Posts.Content: Nannieannie wrote: Hello, I am new to this board and looking for a little information. I had a double mastectomy on 4/27 and was doing really good until las week. I started my chemo on 6/15. Everything was going like clockwork until the 16 when I had my Nulasta injection and back to the surgeon for another drain. She had trouble getting any fluid out and had to find it with an ultrasound. Wednesday I was ok but by Thursday my breast site was swollen and infected. I was running a fever and really sleepy. I slept from 9 pm Wed to late Saturday morning only waking long enough to the bathroom. I was either constipated or had diahrea. I don't know if it was from the infection, chemo or Nulesta. I finally got ahold of the surgeon and got started on antibiotics and have an appointment to see her tomorrow. I am scared to death she is going to put me back in the hospital for IV antibiotics. I am supposed to leave for a weeks vacation on Sunday before I loose my hair. Anyone else had any thing close to this? Thanks, NannieannieÂ  Dx 3/27/2009, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/15 nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Infection Nannieannie Nannieannie
